title: الاسْتِغَاثَة
description: Learn about الاستغاثة, a special form of النداء (vocative) used to seek help or support, formed with يَا followed by a noun with لام: يَا لَلَّهِ، يَا لَلْمُسْلِمِينَ.

notes.title: What is الاستغاثة?
content: الاستغاثة is a special form of the vocative (النداء) used to call upon someone for help, support, or rescue. It expresses urgent need and appeals to the one being called.
It consists of the particle يَا followed by the one called upon (المستغاث به) with a لام, then often followed by the cause of distress (المستغاث له/منه) also with a لام.
keyPoints: المستغاث به = the one called upon for help
المستغاث له/منه = the cause or victim
Always uses يَا as the vocative particle

examples.english: O my people! (save us) from oppression!

notes.title: The لام of الاستغاثة
content: The المستغاث به (one called for help) takes a لام that is مفتوحة (with fatha): يَا لَزَيْدٍ. This لام is a حرف جر (preposition).
The المستغاث له (the one being helped) takes a لام that is مكسورة (with kasra): يَا لَزَيْدٍ لِعَمْرٍو - 'O Zayd! (help) Amr!'
keyPoints: Exception: If المستغاث به has ال, the لام merges: يَا لَلَّهِ

examples.english: O my people! (attend to) this matter!

notes.title: الاستغاثة with مِنْ
content: When seeking help against something (المستغاث منه), the preposition مِنْ is used instead of لِ. This indicates the source of harm or the enemy.
يَا لَلْمُسْلِمِينَ مِنَ الْكُفَّارِ - 'O Muslims! (help against) the disbelievers!'
keyPoints: مِنْ = against, from (the source of harm)
يَا لَزَيْدٍ مِنْ عَمْرٍو = O Zayd! (help me against) Amr
Expresses seeking help from an oppressor/enemy
The structure: يَا + لام مفتوحة + مستغاث به + مِنْ + مستغاث منه

examples.english: O people! (save us) from this tyranny!

notes.title: Classical Examples and Usage
content: الاستغاثة appears in classical Arabic poetry and prose. The poets used it to express deep emotional appeals for help in times of distress.
In the Quran, related vocative expressions appear, though the classical الاستغاثة form with double لام is primarily found in poetry and classical prose.
keyPoints: Expresses urgency and deep emotional need
Used in situations of war, oppression, calamity
The المستغاث به must be capable of helping

examples.english: O men! (rise for) the day of battle!
O Bakr tribe! Help your brother!
O Quraysh! (what will you do about) Muhammad!
O wise ones! (save us) from the ignorant!

exercises.promptEn: O Muslims! (help) the oppressed! (insert correct لام)
O people! (save us) from oppression! (preposition for 'against')
The لام of المستغاث به has _____ (the vowel)
The لام of المستغاث له has _____

exercises.answer: the one called upon for help

exercises.prompt: the source of harm (being called against)
